Syria's last embroiderers: 'I lost my home and my fields, but I always kept this bag'
subhead: A symbol of the country's diversity, Syrian embroidery nearly disappeared during the 13 years of civil war. Since the fall of Bashar al-Assad in late 2024, a group of women led by a German woman in her 70s has been trying to keep this age-old art alive.

title: Martin Parr, extraordinary photographer of the ordinary, dies at 73
subhead: Famed worldwide for his saturated images capturing leisure society, the British photographer died of cancer on Saturday at the age of 73.

subhead: The 56-year-old American filmmaker has released a new feature film on Netflix, starring George Clooney as an aging Hollywood star.

title: The lawyer suing far-right French mayors for setting up Nativity scenes
subhead: French courts have repeatedly ruled that installing Nativity scenes in town halls is a breach of the 1905 law separating the churches and the state. Sophie Mazas works tirelessly to ensure the principle of 'laïcité' is enforced.

For this pilot's widow, Sarkozy's Libyan funding case is personal
subhead: The 1989 bombing of UTA Flight 772, ordered by the Libyan regime of Muammar Gaddafi, robbed Maryvone Raveneau of her husband. As a plaintiff in the trial of Nicolas Sarkozy, who is accused of having struck a deal with Gaddafi, she has been disappointed by the media battle waged by the former French president and his supporters.

title: US national security strategy targets Europe and spares adversaries
subhead: The document released by the White House on Friday, in which Washington's traditional alliances no longer entail any real commitment, marks a historic break from the post-1945 era.

title: Did French authorities know cement company Lafarge was funding terrorist groups?
subhead: A French court sought on Thursday to shed light on the persistent suspicion of state complicity in the Lafarge terrorist financing case. Between the proven lie of a Lafarge executive to a diplomat and the timely forgetfulness of an ambassador, the fog has only thickened.
